From the angle addition and subtraction formula, $\cos (\alpha + \beta) + \sin (\alpha - \beta) = 0$ becomes
\[\cos \alpha \cos \beta - \sin \alpha \sin \beta + \sin \alpha \cos \beta - \cos \alpha \sin \beta = 0.\]Dividing by $\cos \alpha \cos \beta,$ this becomes
\[1 - \tan \alpha \tan \beta + \tan \alpha - \tan \beta = 0.\]We can factor this as
\[(1 + \tan \alpha)(1 - \tan \beta) = 0.\]Since $\tan \beta \neq 1,$ we have that $\tan \alpha = \boxed{-1}.$
